channel.title: Is this possible?
channel.description: Ok well im making a project and for the title screen i want to use shapes instead of the default Square box, i want something like this: [img]http://i3.tinypic.com/2qnmmbc.jpg[/img] But i want to hide the form and jut show whats inside the square, is this possible, if not. What can i do to get it like that?

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:

wonderguy6:

Whoops sorry, i had it on Visible=False lol

Now that is funny!

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

You probably didn’t make sure it was in pixels.
Is the form’s scalemode on pixels instead of twips?

Whoever put twips as default for VB, should be sent to hell. It’s so stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Np.
Meh lol…
Also forgot that it’s relative to the form’s client window.
So unless you have a borderless form, you’ll have to also add onto the left and top position because of the form’s borders and title. So… just manually get the numbers through trial and error if you have to (easiest way). You don’t need the shape object really, I guess… lol

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

k thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

An ellipse that has the same width and height is a circle.
Using the shape (like in your screenie), you’d do something like:

hRgn = CreateEllipticRgn(Shape1.Left, Shape1.Top, Shape1.Width, Shape1.Height)

That should show just the things inside that circle shape. (making sure those number are in pixels and not twips)[br][size=1]Posted on: January 11, 2007, 03:10:30 AM[/size][hr]Actually… I just remember that the shape object doesn’t fit exactly to the dimensions of the circle. So that may not work perfectly until you size the control up exactly to the circle.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

You are my god cruel![br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2007, 07:02:31 PM[/size][hr]but how do i make it for a circle :S

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Easy:

[code]Private Declare Function CreateEllipticRgn Lib “gdi32” (ByVal X1 As Long, ByVal Y1 As Long, ByVal X2 As Long, ByVal Y2 As Long) As Long
Private Declare Function SetWindowRgn Lib “user32” (ByVal hWnd As Long, ByVal hRgn As Long, ByVal bRedraw As Boolean) As Long

Private Sub Form_Load()
Dim hRgn As Long
Me.ScaleMode = vbPixels
hRgn = CreateEllipticRgn(0, 0, Me.ScaleWidth, Me.ScaleHeight)
SetWindowRgn Me.hWnd, hRgn, True
End Sub[/code]

Read full topic
